Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black (mostly worn) save reserved dot at centre; exterior: bowl and top of foot reserved, glazed streaky black below; inscription on reserved underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros. The number in Petrie's catalogue, '47', is written in pen on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 47)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1077) (phase 2)
